title: Congress highlights recommendations of Parliament panel calling for legal guarantee for MSP
desc: The parliamentary standing committee has recommended a legal guarantee for MSP, loan waivers, and extending MSP to organic crops. Financial support for crop residue management, universal crop insurance for small farmers, and renaming the Agriculture Department to include farm labourers' welfare have also been suggested.

title: India blocks United States' farmers, claims America's Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick
desc: America's Commerce Secretary, Howard Lutnick, stated that India blocks U.S. farmers' products and emphasized that President Trump aims to negotiate with countries like India that hinder access to global markets. He praised the UK and Mexico for avoiding retaliation against U.S. tariffs but warned that countries upsetting Trump could face severe responses.

title: Tur procurement under Price Support Scheme reaches 1.31 lakh tons: Agriculture Ministry
desc: The Centre has procured 1.31 lakh tonnes of tur under the Price Support Scheme for the 2024-25 Kharif season, benefiting over 89,000 farmers across five states. Procurement will commence soon in other regions, with approvals for masur and urad as well. This initiative aims for self-sufficiency in pulses by 2029.

title: Tur procurement begins in major states; Govt to procure 100% of Tur, Urad and Masur
desc: Tur (Arhar) dal procurement has commenced in major producing states such as Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Karnataka, Maharashtra, and Telangana, with 1.31 LMT already procured by March 11, 2025. This benefits 89,219 farmers. The government plans to expand procurement efforts to other states soon under the PM-AASHA Scheme.

title: Jammu and Kashmir weather update: Rain and snow recoded in several parts of the valley even as temperatures remain above normal
desc: Jammu and Kashmir is experiencing wet weather with fresh snowfall in higher altitudes and heavy rainfall in many parts. The temperature has dropped, affecting normal activities. The weather department expects intermittent rain or snow until Sunday. Tourists should follow traffic advisories, and farmers are advised to halt activities until March 18.

title: Donald Trump administration cuts over $1 billion in food programs for schools, food banks
desc: The Trump administration has cut over $1 billion in food programs that funded schools and food banks, impacting millions of children and local farmers. The move, part of broader federal spending reductions, has drawn sharp criticism from officials and advocacy groups. With food prices rising and food banks struggling, concerns grow over increased hunger and economic strain on communities.

title: Govt ready to include farmers in PM Kisan Samman Nidhi who are not part of it yet: Agri minister
desc: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced that the government is prepared to offer Rs 6,000 annual cash benefit under the PM Kisan Samman Nidhi to all eligible farmers not yet included. State governments are urged to help identify these farmers and ensure they receive the benefit without delay.

title: USDA cuts over $1 billion in funding for schools, local food purchases
desc: The U.S. Agriculture Department cut over $1 billion in funds for programs aiding schools and food banks in purchasing from local farms and ranches. These cuts are part of efforts to reduce federal spending under President Trump's administration. The decision has led to concerns among farmers and food organizations, who are now cutting staff and halting investments.

title: India produced record rice, wheat, maize in 2024-25, estimates Centre
desc: India achieved record rice, wheat, and maize production in the 2024-25 kharif season, according to the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare's second advance estimates. Kharif foodgrains production reached 1,663.91 lakh tonnes, while rabi foodgrains amounted to 1,645.27 lakh tonnes. These estimates provide significant insights into the country's agricultural output for major crops.

title: Jumla, nothing special for farmers: Uddhav Thackery slams Maharashtra Budget
desc: Uddhav Thackeray criticizes the Maharashtra Budget 2025-26 for lacking substantial support for farmers and deems it filled with election gimmicks. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar defended it, emphasizing significant provisions for various sectors and ambitious growth targets. The budget focuses on enhancing infrastructure, boosting investments, and increasing employment opportunities.

title: Who is Brooke Rollins, US Secretary of Agriculture
desc: Brooke Rollins has been sworn in as the 33rd U.S. Secretary of Agriculture, with significant support from the Senate. She is set to focus on strengthening rural America, supporting farmers, and ensuring food security. Rollins brings extensive experience in public policy and administration to her new role.

title: SOPA urges govt to safeguard Indian soybean industry amidst bilateral trade with the US
desc: SOPA has requested the government to protect the interests of the Indian soybean industry amid ongoing India-USA trade negotiations. They suggest maintaining current import duties on soybean products and exploring concessional duty arrangements for value-added soy products. Additionally, they emphasized on prioritizing negotiations to reduce the countervailing duty imposed by the US on Indian organic soybean meal.

title: Farmers put plans, investments on hold under Trump USDA spending freeze
desc: USDA's grant freeze under the Trump administration has left farmers across the U.S. facing financial instability, halting projects and risking bankruptcy. Farmers like Nate Powell-Palm in Montana are directly impacted, with significant investments on hold. The freeze, along with new tariffs, is straining the agricultural sector while USDA and White House reviews continue.

title: India should protect its national interest while negotiating with US: Swadeshi Jagran Manch
desc: The Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM) urges India to focus on bilateral trade agreements to protect national interests, especially for farmers and small entrepreneurs. At a meeting in Chhattisgarh, the SJM highlighted the need to enhance foreign trade amid the Trump administration's policy of reciprocal tariffs, which aim to boost US manufacturing.

title: US push for grand trade agreement; opening agri sector: An explainer
desc: The US is urging India to negotiate a comprehensive trade agreement, with a key focus on opening India's agriculture sector. This would involve reducing import tariffs, potentially impacting 700 million rural livelihoods. India currently imposes tariffs ranging from zero to 150% to protect its farmers. US seeks to export heavily subsidised farm products, which India views as sensitive.

title: Patanjali inaugurates Asia's largest orange processing unit in Nagpur
desc: Patanjali has inaugurated Asia's largest orange processing plant in Nagpur, Maharashtra, with a capacity of 800 tonnes per day. The project, costing Rs 1500 crore, aims to benefit farmers and create numerous jobs, focusing on zero-waste operations and producing export-quality products.

title: Opposition to raise tariff issue in Parliament on Monday
desc: Opposition parties plan to address the government's response to the US push for reciprocal tariffs in Parliament, along with concerns about population-based delimitation and the new language policy. The Congress questions whether Indian interests have been compromised in tariff negotiations, demanding clarity from Prime Minister Modi.

title: Challenges in building localised AI data and responsible frameworks: AWS' Shalini Kapoor
desc: AWS' Shalini Kapoor emphasised the need for India-specific AI data sets to address unique challenges in sectors like health and agriculture. She also highlighted the importance of responsible AI frameworks, model explainability, and user interaction in AI development.

title: Elon Musk’s DOGE whiz kids took matters into their own hands, flew to California to release water during raging Los Angeles wildfires
desc: Elon Musk’s DOGE whiz kids took matters into their own hands, attempting to turn on California’s water pumps during the devastating Los Angeles wildfires. Despite federal officials denying their request, DOGE staffers Tyler Hassen and Bryton Shang flew to California to activate the system themselves. However, maintenance shutdowns and lack of authority stopped them. Trump later ordered a massive water release, claiming it would prevent wildfires, though experts disagreed. Farmers raised concerns about the impact on irrigation.

title: Take Parliament into confidence: Congress to PM on Trump's India cutting trade tariff claim
desc: The Congress demanded PM Modi to clarify Trump's claim that India has agreed to lower trade tariffs. Opposition leader Jairam Ramesh raised concerns about the potential impact on Indian farmers and manufacturers, calling for transparency in Parliament. Trump asserted that India imposes massive tariffs, hindering US trade.

title: 'What has Modi government agreed to?' Jairam Ramesh questions Centre on Trump's tariff statement
desc: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh has questioned India's decision to reduce tariffs following Donald Trump's statement. With Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal in Washington, Ramesh is concerned about possible compromises affecting Indian farmers and manufacturers. This situation demands transparency from the Modi government, as it is seen as compromising national interests.

title: US tariffs on Canadian dairy, lumber could come 'today': Donald Trump
desc: President Donald Trump announced potential tariffs on Canadian dairy and lumber products, accusing Canada of unfair trade practices. Despite delaying some tariffs aimed at Canada and Mexico, Trump emphasized that the tariffs could be enacted soon if Canada does not adjust its trade policies, impacting US farmers and industries.

title: US stopping all federal funding to South Africa, Donald Trump says
desc: U.S. President Donald Trump announced that the United States will cease all federal funding to South Africa. Additionally, Trump stated that South African farmers facing safety concerns will be offered expedited U.S. citizenship. The new policy will take effect immediately, impacting the $323.4 million in planned U.S. aid for 2024.

title: Increase share of states in Central taxes pool to 48%, MP CM tells 16th Finance Commission
desc: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav called for an increase in states' share of Central taxes from 44% to 48% to boost development. Emphasizing the progress in various sectors, he highlighted the state's financial goals, major projects, and efforts to attract investment and support farmers.

title: 'Bear with me', Trump says as both farmers, consumers brace for tariff effects
desc: New tariffs on Mexico, Canada, and China are expected to significantly impact US farmers and meat producers, potentially hurting their profits and leading to higher consumer prices for some products. President Trump may offer aid payments to offset these losses, as he did during his first administration. However, the long-term effects could strain the economy and affect trade relationships.

title: 'Bear with me,' Trump says as both farmers and consumers brace for tariff effects
desc: The new tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China are expected to impact U.S. farmers and meat producers, potentially resulting in higher prices for consumers and economic repercussions. While President Trump has asked farmers for patience, the situation remains uncertain, with farmers worried about increased costs and decreased profitability, and potential long-term damage to trading relationships.

title: Big step towards better animal health: PM Modi on Cabinet's approval for revised livestock program
desc: Prime Minister Modi praised the Union Cabinet's approved revision of the Livestock Health & Disease Control Programme (LHDCP), highlighting its potential to enhance animal health and farmer prosperity. The program, with a Rs. 3,880 crore budget, focuses on disease control, vaccination, mobile vet units, and affordable medicines for the years 2024-25 and 2025-26.

title: Amid protests, CM Bhagwant Mann calls Punjab 'dharna' state
desc: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expressed concern over the state becoming a 'dharna state' after inconclusive talks with Samyukta Kisan Morcha leaders. The ongoing protests are resulting in significant economic losses for the state. Farmer leaders, who plan to protest in Chandigarh, claimed multiple detentions and criticized Mann's handling of their concerns as disrespectful.

title: Andhra govt spending over Rs 12,400 cr on free power to farmers: Energy Minister Ravi Kumar
desc: Andhra Pradesh Energy Minister G Ravi Kumar announced that the government is investing over Rs 12,400 crore to provide free power to farmers under the NDA-led administration. The state plans to supply nine hours of free electricity and has approved nearly 70,000 new connections. Efforts to curb illegal marijuana cultivation have also seen significant progress.
